intro: Phlomoides woroschilovii, commonly known as the Woroschilov's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
